alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 9:14PM EDT until September 07 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Kent County in central Delaware... East central Queen Anne`s County in northeastern Maryland... Northeastern Caroline County in eastern Maryland... * Until 1000 PM EDT. * At 913 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sandtown, or 12 miles west of Dover, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Dover, Smyrna, Camden, Cheswold, Goldsboro, Woodside, Viola, Hartly, Rising Sun-Lebanon, Hazlettville, Dover Base Housing, Dover Speedway, Sandtown, Rising Sun, Wyoming, Kenton, Little Creek, Leipsic, Henderson and Marydel. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
